q: rivals, said:`` Eric Schmidt has been at it for a decade, a very long time to be running a company, particularly one that has very headstrong founders in key positions of power.'' I think it's fair to say that Larry Page will not be a conventional CEO- he's not been much of a public figure for the past ten years, John Battelle added on his blog, John Battellemedia.com.`` It will be interesting to see if that changes, or if Larry Page chafes at the relentless public demands of running a massively scrutinized public company.''
